Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and bears the faint impression of three lines of cord-marked decoration and the smudged remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Curator's comments: The hand of this receipt is very bad, and the ink has run; hence some readings are doubtful.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.186)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36439) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36439)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 297 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13485 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
